definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

sentences.english: But the exercising rats metabolized calories differently.
sentences.chinese: 而运动组的大鼠其能量代谢则存在着差异。

sentences.english: The recent research has reported that FOXC2 plays an important role in energy metabolism.
sentences.chinese: FOXC2在能量代谢中发挥重要调节作用。

sentences.english: The measurement of respiratory control rate is an important method in studying energy metabolism.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸控制率的测定是研究能量代谢的重要方法之一。

definition: anabolism (biology)/constructive metabolism (using energy to make proteins etc)/assimilation
catabolism (biology)/metabolic breaking down and waste disposal/dissimilation
thyroid hormone/thyroxine (used to treat underactive thyroid)
